	Cancer remedy apricot kernels 'contain deadly amounts of cyanide'
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3588156/Cancer-remedy-apricot-kernels-deadly-Warning-latest-fad-fruit-s-seeds-contain-high-levels-cyanide.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490

	Silicon implant 'helps worn knees to regrow' sparing thousands of patients surgery
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3588052/Silicon-implant-helps-worn-knees-regrow-Thousands-patients-spared-surgery-development-bouncy-bio-glass-mimics-cartilage.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490

	Dean Karnazes can jog 350 miles without stopping thanks to rare genetic condition
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3588109/Super-human-marathon-runner-Dean-Karnazes-jog-350-miles-without-stopping-thanks-rare-genetic-condition.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490

    <item>
      <title>
	Half of middle-aged British men classed as problem drinkers
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3587996/Half-middle-aged-British-men-classed-problem-drinkers-Average-45-65-year-old-downs-two-half-times-recommended-alcohol-limit-week.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>

    <item>
      <title>
	Are oranges and grapes key to fighting the flab?
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3587837/Are-oranges-grapes-key-fighting-flab-Two-compounds-help-beat-obesity-diabetes-heart-disease.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>

    <item>
      <title>
	Scientists find why agony persists even when the injury that caused it has gone
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3587283/Why-DOES-chronic-pain-exist-Scientists-agony-persists-injury-caused-gone.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>
	The King's College London research could explain how small and seemingly innocuous injuries leave molecular 'footprints' which add up to more lasting damage, and ultimately chronic pain.
      </description>

    <item>
      <title>
	Meet the hormone that can make you feel calmer and look younger 
      </title>
      <link>
	http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3587104/Want-relieve-stress-Meet-hormone-make-feel-calmer-look-younger.html?ITO=1490&ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490
      </link>
      <description>
	DHEA is a naturally-occurring hormone in the body with a calming and anti-ageing effect, helping relieve stress. It is available in pill form but also through eating oily fish, nuts and seeds.
